intro: Galactites ludovicae, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often covered in fine, white hairs. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Galactites ludovicae is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
